comment.body: This fix will be included in Play 2.3.1. In the meantime you need to make sure that you only run one test at a time.

issue.title: Stop ClosableLazy throwing NPE when close called before get
Play 2.3 w/ scala 2.11 & dependency scala compiler 2.11
issue.body:
With this combination I have problems since sbt-plugin and other play specific plugins use scala 2.10 and I need the to import scala compiler 2.11 in my code.

The issue is referenced here too: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24196192/play-2-3-run-error

Still if i only have a simpler project with only the dependency it seems to not fail.

I checked two important dependency versions and concluded:
* Every subproject has version 2.11.1
* Every dependency has version 2.11 although some have 2.11.0 instead of 2.11.1.

Is this a bug?
If not:
* is there any way for the play to use scala 2.11 instead of 2.10?
* how can I build my app when I need scala compiler 2.11?

comment.body: The problem was only related with missing deps in the lib folder. Sorry for the trouble.

issue.title: Play 2.3 w/ scala 2.11 & dependency scala compiler 2.11
issue.body:
With this combination I have problems since sbt-plugin and other play specific plugins use scala 2.10 and I need the to import scala compiler 2.11 in my code.

The issue is referenced here too: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24196192/play-2-3-run-error

Still if i only have a simpler project with only the dependency it seems to not fail.

I checked two important dependency versions and concluded:
* Every subproject has version 2.11.1
* Every dependency has version 2.11 although some have 2.11.0 instead of 2.11.1.

Is this a bug?
If not:
* is there any way for the play to use scala 2.11 instead of 2.10?
* how can I build my app when I need scala compiler 2.11?

comment.body:
The issue still exists for me. I'm using Play 2.3 with Java under Windows.
The test have been setup in Play 2.2 and always run as expected. They are basically integration test so a fakeApplication and a testServer are created for each test. As a persistance layer JPA+Hibernate is used. On 2.3 I can't run my test properly anymore in Intellij as well as in activator or activator ui. The behavor is the same either they get stuck or the fail with an absurd error message like:
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: play.Play.application()Lplay/Application;
Encountered a deprecated javax.persistence.spi.PersistenceProvider [org.hibernate.ejb.HibernatePersistence]; use [org.hibernate.jpa.HibernatePersistenceProvider] instead. But this is not the case, I do use the correct JPA version.

The strange think about that is that some of the test sometimes work and again sometimes don't. And when they work it seems they take more time then they used to. What is even more strange is that some test do work when run separately but fail if run as a suit. That is why I suspecting also a Threading issue.

I use Java 8 Update 5 (jdk1.8.0_05)

For further inside I added a Thread dumb when the system got stuck again:

issue.title: [2.3] Test deadlock
issue.body:
I like to report a reproducible test deadlock behavior in Play 2.3.
The test have been setup in Play 2.2 and always run as expected. They are basically integration test so a fakeApplication and a testServer are created for each test. As a persistance layer JPA+Hibernate is used. On 2.3  I can't run my test properly anymore in Intellij as well as in activator or activator ui. The behavor is the same either they get stuck or the fail with an absurd error message like:
 java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: play.Play.application()Lplay/Application;
Encountered a deprecated javax.persistence.spi.PersistenceProvider [org.hibernate.ejb.HibernatePersistence]; use [org.hibernate.jpa.HibernatePersistenceProvider] instead. But this is not the case, I do use the correct JPA version.

The strange think about that is that some of the test sometimes work and again sometimes don't. And when they work it seems they take more time then they used to. What is even more strange is that some test do work when run separately but fail if run as a suit. That is why I suspecting also a Threading issue.

I use Java 8 Update 5 (jdk1.8.0_05)

For further inside I added a Thread dumb when the system got stuck again:

issue.title: [2.3] Test deadlock
issue.body:
I like to report a reproducible test deadlock behavior in Play 2.3.
The test have been setup in Play 2.2 and always run as expected. They are basically integration test so a fakeApplication and a testServer are created for each test. As a persistance layer JPA+Hibernate is used. On 2.3  I can't run my test properly anymore in Intellij as well as in activator or activator ui. The behavor is the same either they get stuck or the fail with an absurd error message like:
 java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: play.Play.application()Lplay/Application;
Encountered a deprecated javax.persistence.spi.PersistenceProvider [org.hibernate.ejb.HibernatePersistence]; use [org.hibernate.jpa.HibernatePersistenceProvider] instead. But this is not the case, I do use the correct JPA version.

The strange think about that is that some of the test sometimes work and again sometimes don't. And when they work it seems they take more time then they used to. What is even more strange is that some test do work when run separately but fail if run as a suit. That is why I suspecting also a Threading issue.

I use Java 8 Update 5 (jdk1.8.0_05)

For further inside I added a Thread dumb when the system got stuck again:

issue.title: WS: better error handling when the hostname cannot be verified for an HTTPS call
issue.body:
When:
- using the WS client
- making an HTTPS connection
- the host name cannot be verified

the current error handling is the following:
- the caller does not receive any exception
- after a while, a `NullPointerException` is thrown in `handleError(app: Application)`

Sample application to reproduce this behavior (making a call to https://github.com/):
https://github.com/yanns/WS-hostname

The logs:
```
[info] play - Application started (Dev)
[info] application - cannot verify 'github.com'
```
and after a while:
```
[error] application - 

! @6i5f7ccmk - Internal server error, for (GET) [/] ->

play.api.Application$$anon$1: Execution exception[[NullPointerException: null]]
	at play.api.Application$class.handleError(Application.scala:293) ~[play_2.10-2.2.3.jar:2.2.3]
	at play.api.DefaultApplication.handleError(Application.scala:399) [play_2.10-2.2.3.jar:2.2.3]
	at play.core.server.netty.PlayDefaultUpstreamHandler$$anonfun$13$$anonfun$apply$1.applyOrElse(PlayDefaultUpstreamHandler.scala:166) [play_2.10-2.2.3.jar:2.2.3]
	at play.core.server.netty.PlayDefaultUpstreamHandler$$anonfun$13$$anonfun$apply$1.applyOrElse(PlayDefaultUpstreamHandler.scala:163) [play_2.10-2.2.3.jar:2.2.3]
	at scala.runtime.AbstractPartialFunction.apply(AbstractPartialFunction.scala:33) [scala-library-2.10.3.jar:na]
	at scala.util.Failure$$anonfun$recover$1.apply(Try.scala:185) [scala-library-2.10.3.jar:na]
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
	at org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpClientCodec$Decoder.isContentAlwaysEmpty(HttpClientCodec.java:179) ~[netty-3.7.1.Final.jar:na]
	at org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpMessageDecoder.readHeaders(HttpMessageDecoder.java:514) ~[netty-3.7.1.Final.jar:na]
	at org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpMessageDecoder.decode(HttpMessageDecoder.java:193) ~[netty-3.7.1.Final.jar:na]
	at org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpClientCodec$Decoder.decode(HttpClientCodec.java:143) ~[netty-3.7.1.Final.jar:na]
	at org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpClientCodec$Decoder.decode(HttpClientCodec.java:127) ~[netty-3.7.1.Final.jar:na]
	at org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.replay.ReplayingDecoder.callDecode(ReplayingDecoder.java:500) ~[netty-3.7.1.Final.jar:na]
```

comment.body: From https://github.com/AsyncHttpClient/async-http-client/issues/555, it seems like this only happens in 1.8, not in 1.9 / master.

issue.title: Reverse Router should use minified assets in production automatically

comment.body: I've attached a PR to this issue that has the asset controller check for the existence of `.min.*` and `-min.*` for all asset requests.
